summaryText: What an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about breaking free from our personal 'Egypts' and moving forward into God's promised land! PT delivered a powerful sermon about not going back to the places, people, and patterns God has delivered us from. Just like the Israelites wanted to return to slavery in Egypt, we often find ourselves tempted to go back to toxic relationships, addictions, and mindsets that once held us captive. Pastor Travis reminds us that God has a divine plan for our lives that is far greater than we can imagine! Can you imagine God seeing potential in you that you can't even see in yourself? He uses examples like Moses and Gideon to show how God calls the unlikely and qualifies them for His purpose. The most powerful takeaway? God is not done with you yet - whether you're 9 or 90, He has a plan and a purpose. Pastor Travis challenges us to forget the former things, strain toward what's ahead, and press into God's promises. His personal stories about his wife's battle with endometriosis and his own journey of ministry illustrate that God's promises require us to leave our past behind. The key? Stay connected to the right people, stay committed to God's process, and never, ever go back to the Egypt of your past!
mainPoints: God has a divine plan for my life
God is just getting started with me
God sees things in me that I cannot see in myself
God's promise requires me to leave the past behind

versesMentioned.text: For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'

For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well. My frame was not hidden from you when I was made in the secret place, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth. Your eyes saw my unformed body; all the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be.
Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.
Don't let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example for the believers in speech, in life, in love, in faith and in purity.
So now, go. I am sending you to Pharaoh to bring my people the Israelites out of Egypt.
Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.

Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 43:19: 'See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's new work in your life
Monday.action: Take time to reflect on areas where you've been stuck in old patterns. Journal about what 'new things' God might be preparing for you.
Monday.prayer: Lord, open my eyes to the new path You are creating. Help me let go of past limitations and trust Your vision for my life. Give me courage to step into the new things You have prepared. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13: 'Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead.'
Tuesday.focus: Releasing the past and pressing forward
Tuesday.action: Identify one past hurt or negative experience that's holding you back. Write a letter of release, symbolically letting go and surrendering it to God.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I release the pain of my past to You. Help me not be defined by previous failures or wounds. Fill me with hope and courage to press forward into Your promises. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Psalm 139:14: 'I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.'
Wednesday.action: List five unique qualities or talents God has given you. Pray about how you can use these to honor Him and impact others.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, thank You for creating me with purpose and intention. Help me see myself as You see me - fearfully and wonderfully made. Show me how to steward the gifts You've placed in me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Thursday.focus: Trusting God's plans over your own
Thursday.action: Spend time in prayer mapping out your current goals. Ask God to align your plans with His divine purpose for your life.
Thursday.prayer: God, I surrender my plans and dreams to You. Redirect my steps and help me trust Your perfect plan. Give me wisdom to discern Your leading and courage to follow. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 1 Timothy 4:12: 'Don't let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example for the believers in speech, in life, in love, in faith and in purity.'
Friday.focus: Walking in purpose regardless of age or perceived limitations
Friday.action: Reach out to someone who might need encouragement. Share a story of how God has been working in your life.
Friday.prayer: Father, use me as an instrument of Your hope and love. Help me be bold in my faith and live in a way that brings glory to Your name, regardless of my age or limitations. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Saturday.focus: Embracing your new identity in Christ
Saturday.action: Do a personal inventory. Identify areas where you're still holding onto old patterns and pray for complete renewal.
Saturday.prayer: Lord Jesus, thank You for making all things new. Help me fully embrace my identity in You. Reveal and remove any remnants of my old self that don't align with Your purpose. Make me new from the inside out. Amen.
